com.samsung.android.sdk.composer.document

Class SpenContentText

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.composer.document.SpenContentBase
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.composer.document.SpenContentText

  • public class SpenContentText
extends SpenContentBase
    This class represents a text and provides methods for managing text.

    Some APIs and variables are moved or integrated to super class SpenContentBase since 5.0.0.
    Since:
    5.0.0

      • setSpan

        public void setSpan(ArrayList<SpenTextSpan> list)
        Set the specified span information. If the new span and the existing span share a type and their regions overlap, the span overlap region is merged internally.
        So the span value that is set and the span value that is got may not both always match.
        Overrides:
        setSpan in class SpenContentBase
        Parameters:
        list - The span information.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • getSpan

        public ArrayList<SpenTextSpan> getSpan()

        Overrides:
        getSpan in class SpenContentBase
        Returns:
        The span information.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • findSpan

                                        int endIndex)
        Find the list of spans between the specified start position and end position.
        Overrides:
        findSpan in class SpenContentBase
        Parameters:
        startIndex - The index of the first character for finding span information.
        endIndex - The index of the last character for finding span information.
        Returns:
        The list of span information.
        Since:

        public void appendSpan(SpenTextSpan span)
        Add the specified span information.
        Where there are existing spans, this method merges the new span with the existing spans.

      • insertText

        public void insertText(String text,
                       int position)
        Insert the text at the position in the text box.
        If the position is negative or larger than the length of the entire text, an exception is thrown.
        In the new text, the span style follows the existing text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to insert.
        position - The position in the text box to insert the text.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the position is negative or larger than the text box length. If the text of TextBox is NULL and the position is not 0.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        insertTextAtCursor(String)

      • insertTextAtCursor

        public void insertTextAtCursor(String text)
        Insert the text at the current cursor position.
        After insertion, the cursor moves to the end of the new text.
        In the new text, the span style follows the existing text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to insert.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        insertText(String, int)

      • removeText

        public void removeText(int startIndex,
                       int length)
        Delete the text from the position with the length.
        If the delete position is negative or larger than the length of the entire text, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - The start index of the text to be deleted.
        length - The length of the text to be deleted.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If startPosition is negative or larger than the length of the entire text
        IllegalStateException - If the text of TextBox is NULL.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • replaceText

        public void replaceText(String text,
                        int startIndex,
                        int length)
        Replace the text specified by the starting position and length with the new text.
        Span and paragraph data are retained and applied to the new text.
        Parameters:
        text - The new text.
        startIndex - The start index of the text to be replaced.
        length - The length of the text to be replaced.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If startPosition is negative or larger than the length of the entire text. Or the text of TextBox is NULL.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • removeAllText

        public void removeAllText()
        Delete the entire text including span and paragraph data.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • setCursorPosition

        public void setCursorPosition(int position)
        Set the cursor at the specified position. If the position is less than 0 or larger than the length of the entire text, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        position - The cursor position
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If position passed is negative or larger than the length of the entire text.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        getCursorPosition()

      • getCursorPosition

        public int getCursorPosition()
        Get cursor position.
        Returns:
        the cursor position
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        setCursorPosition(int)

      • setHintTextEnabled

        public void setHintTextEnabled(boolean enable)
        Show or hide the hint text.
        Parameters:

        Since:
        5.0.0

      • isHintTextEnabled

        public boolean isHintTextEnabled()
        Check if hint text is enabled.
        Returns:
        true or false. If true, The hint text is "enabled".
        Since:
